Literature.Title: B1CTcu5: A frog-derived brevinin-1 peptide with anti-tuberculosis activity.

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Rabbit erythrocytes:38% Hemolysis=200 µg/ml,Human erythrocytes:40% Hemolysis=200 µg/ml,Human embryonic kidney HEK293 cells:50% Cytotoxicity=>100 µg/ml,Human PBMC:50% Cytotoxicity=75.1±1.46 µg/ml
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus MTCC 9542(MIC=>100µg/ml),Bacillus subtilis MTCC 14416(MIC=50µg/ml),Bacillus coagulans ATCC 7050(MIC=6.25-15µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212(MIC=100µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 43300(MIC=>100µg/ml),Escherichia coli MG1655(MIC=7-25µg/ml),Vibrio cholerae(MIC=15-25µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=>100µg/ml),Human epidermoid carcinoma A431(50-60% Cytotoxicity=>100µg/ml),Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv(MIC=12.5±0.5µg/ml),Mycobacterium smegmatis NCIM 5138(no activity data),Human acute monocytic leukemia THP-1(no activity data)
